ygData.subject: Re: Fetch process
ygData.msgSnippet: Hello, Yes, you are right. In the regular expression one slash has to be. Thanks. The question is where in order.xml file (in which tag section) I should

Hello, 
 
Yes, you are right. In the regular expression one slash has to be=
. 
Thanks. 
 
The question is where in 'order.xml' file (in which tag secti=
on) I 
should place this regular expression to get in 'crawl.log' URIs with=
 
only these extensions (*.doc, *.ppt). 
 
Thanks, 
 
Artem. 
 
--- In arch=
ive-crawler@yahoogroups.com, M C <manavx81@...> wrote: 
> 
> Hi, 
>  
> Not=
 quite sure on your question, but I would check the regular 
expression, 
>=
 .*(?i)\.(doc|ppt)$, not sure why you have two slashes. 
>  
> Let me know =
if this helps. 
>  
> Manav 
>  
> Artem Antonov <antonov.artem@...> wrote:=
                                  
Hi,   
>     
>  Thanks a lot for help. =
  
>  I've added ContentTypeRegExFilter to the 'midfetch-filter' and   
>  =
'write-processors' sections, and now only html/text contents are   
>  save=
d into the ARC file.   
>     
>  The one problem I couldn't solve is to ac=
cept only URIs that end   
>  with the specified pattern (for example, ".do=
c, *.ppt").   
>     
>  I use 'org.archive.crawler.deciderules.DecidingSco=
pe' in Crawl 
Scope   
>  to determine whether a URI is accepted or rejecte=
d. So, in 
'scope'   
>  section I've added:   
>     
>  <newObject name=
=3D"filePattern"   
>  
class=3D"org.archive.crawler.deciderules.MatchesFil=
ePatternDecideRule">   
>     <string name=3D"decision">ACCEPT</string>   
=
>     <string name=3D"use-preset-pattern">Custom</string>   
>     <string =
name=3D"regexp">.*(?i)(\\.(doc|ppt))$</string>   
>  </newObject>   
>     =

>  But in 'crawl.log' file are saved all URIs from fetched 
documents.   
=
>  How to extract only URIs that match the regexp?   
>     
>  Thanks.   
=
>     
>  Regards,   
>  Artem.   
>     
>     
>     
>     
>     
>  --=
